title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: A surprise bonus from COVID-19 vaccines: bolstering cancer treatment
items.description: Patients who got shots of mRNA before starting a type of cancer immunotherapy lived much longer

items.title: Stranded coral boulders point to a medieval tsunami in the Caribbean
items.description: Study pinpoints likely date for a massive earthquake on the Puerto Rico Trench—and highlights an underappreciated regional hazard

items.title: JD Vance officiated the wedding of new head of NIH environmental institute
items.description: Unusual hiring process raises fears of political favoritism

items.title: Lab mice can now have periods like humans
items.description: Studies of rodents with a menstrual on/off switch could help people with endometriosis and other disorders

items.title: Beetle compound is so valuable insects eat bird poop to get it
items.description: To obtain the toxic chemical cantharidin, insects suck beetles’ blood—and even munch on their digested remains

items.title: How poop-eating beetles evolved to eat rotting flesh
items.description: Analysis of thousands of fossils pushes back change in beetles’ diets by more than 37 million years

items.title: Bull’s-eye! Static electricity pulls worm through air to its insect victim
items.description: Electrostatic charges may help roundworms infect a wide variety of hosts

items.title: Common research monkey is endangered, conservation group confirms
items.description: Listing could affect availability for biomedical studies

items.title: These stinkbugs coat their eggs in fungi to protect them from parasitic wasps
items.description: An unusual relationship could shed light on how insects choose their partners

items.title: On an Arctic archipelago, frozen soil may preserve a hidden history of viruses
items.description: Scientists are hunting for ancient RNA in Svalbard’s permafrost, hoping to shed light on the evolution of viral diseases
